meanings.definition: Lackers (verb): to be without or deficient in something
meanings.sent1: She lackers confidence when speaking in public.
meanings.sent2: The team lackers experience in high-pressure situations.
meanings.sent3: The cat lackers interest in the new toy, preferring the box it came in.
meanings.sent4: His jokes lackers humor, falling flat with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The garden lackers color in the winter, but blooms beautifully in spring.

meanings.definition: Lackers (noun): a person or thing that lacks something
meanings.sent1: The lackers of motivation often struggle to achieve their goals.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a lackers in a room full of talented artists.
meanings.sent3: The lackers of rain made the farmers worry about their crops.
meanings.sent4: He was a lackers in the world of fashion, always wearing mismatched outfits.
meanings.sent5: The lackers of sunlight in the room created a gloomy atmosphere.
